description.value:
Evokers are naturally attuned with latent ether locked within inanimate or inorganic objects, which can range from rocks, water, the earth, metals or even the wind. They possess specialized glands in their limbs that allow them to process and draw out the ether from the environment, often unconsciously. Evokers specialize in this ability, often leading them to make use of tools and catalysts in their spell casting more than any other manafont. By bringing out the ether already stored in objects, evokers can conserve and pace themselves by using less of their own.

Evoker Focus Point Feature

Evokers naturally regain Focus Points up to their maximum. Every hour they do not spend Focus Points since their last Refocus, they regain a focus point. You also automatically become trained in one of Arcana, Nature, Religion or Occultism and gain the Trick Magic Item skill feat.

Evoker Refocus

Evokers do not need to perform dedicated activities to Refocus as their bodies naturally take trace amounts of ether from the world around them. As long as they do not perform any strenuous activity such as combat, heavy travel or spellcasting, they are able to perform any other Exploration activity as part of their Refocus, regardless of their source of focus spells. At the end of a ten-minute period of these light activities, they regain one focus point.

If you take a feat that improves your Refocus, you can take up to two qualifying items you can use for Spell Catalyst and drain it during your Refocus. This acts as if the item had been used for Spell Catalyst, but you regain an additional focus point for each item you drain within the ten-minute period. 

@UUID[Compendium.immortal-ardor.feats.Item.3KKQqzNBAHHV3dH2]{Spell Catalyst} (5th)

You are able to make greater use of spell components than other manafonts, drawing out the prime elements of the world from them. You learn the @UUID[Compendium.immortal-ardor.feats.Item.l3ecoYD2MwGUJhaa]{Spell Catalyst} free action. 

@UUID[Compendium.immortal-ardor.feats.Item.KNYzsH5HhDxITTIF]{Component Mastery} (10th)

You can leverage your catalysts as components for a wider variety of spells. You can add Wands and Spellhearts to the items you can use for Spell Catalyst.

When you use a Spellheart, you can use the Spellheart’s traits to check for qualifying traits. When used as a catalyst, the Spellheart becomes inert, unable to be used normally or for Spell Catalyst until your next daily preparations.

When you use a wand, the wand’s charge must not have been spent yet, and you can use the wand’s spell to check for qualifying traits. When you use the wand as a catalyst, the wand loses its charge as if it had been used for the day.

In addition, when you use Spell Catalyst, you can negate up to 2 points of focus point costs.

@UUID[Compendium.immortal-ardor.feats.Item.V8pqHynVScoLlQ2j]{Component Scavenger} (15th)

You can scavenge almost any natural or magical object as a pool of latent ether.

You can use spell tradition traits to check for a qualifying catalyst for Spell Catalyst. In addition, you can use any permanent item that has activation effects for Spell Catalyst. When you do, you can check the item or activation effect’s traits for qualifying traits. After being used in this way, the item’s activation effect cannot be used until your next daily preparations.

Finally, you gain the @UUID[Compendium.immortal-ardor.feats.Item.3jVF7GYzXpbV2eMQ]{Component Scavenger} free action.
